title: I Got Inked by Apo Whang-od
content:
# I Got Inked by Apo Whang-od

A memorable journey with my girlfriend to Buscalan, a small mountain village home to the Butbut tribe.

## The Journey to Buscalan

Reaching Buscalan is an adventure in itself:

- Long bus ride from Manila to Bontoc
- Jeepney ride to the jump-off point
- 1-hour trek up the mountain

## Meeting Apo Whang-od

Apo Whang-od, at over 100 years old, is the oldest traditional tattoo artist in the Philippines. She is the last *mambabatok* (traditional Kalinga tattooist) and a living legend.

### The Traditional Method

The *batok* tattooing method uses:

- A thorn from a pomelo tree as the needle
- Charcoal mixed with water as ink
- A wooden stick to tap the thorn into the skin

## Our Tattoo Experience

We immersed ourselves in their rich culture and had the once-in-a-lifetime experience of getting tattooed by the legendary Apo Whang-od herself.

### The Pain

Honestly? It hurt more than modern tattoo machines. But the cultural significance made every tap worth it.

### The Design

We got the traditional three-dot pattern, which represents:

- Protection
- Bravery
- Connection to the Kalinga heritage

> A trip that left a permanent mark, both on our skin and in our hearts.

## Cultural Immersion

- Stayed overnight in a local homestay
- Experienced the warm hospitality of the Butbut tribe
- Learned about their traditions and way of life

This experience is something I'll treasure forever.
